byline.original: By BEN SISARIO and BRIAN X. CHEN

abstract: Apple is moving ahead with revamp of its digital music services, working with engineers and executives at Beats, which it acquired in 2014, to create streaming service that can compete with other services like Spotify; company also plans to update its iTunes Radio; Apple's choice of Trent Reznor, musician and chief creative officer of Beats, to be point man on project shows how important Beats is to company's digital music plans.
lead_paragraph: The new system will not have a lower price than its competitors, and won’t offer a free version supported by ads.

headline.main: Apple and Beats Developing Streaming Music Service to Rival Spotify
headline.print_headline: Using Beats, Apple Plans Challenger to Spotify

snippet: The new system will not have a lower price than its competitors, and won’t offer a free version supported by ads.
